item.description:
I'm taking a break?

From writing... not riding!!!


The Ride:

Last week, after a rather typical beginning to our ride, which featured a nugget or two among a whole lotta rock and root, we strung together a couple of trails we’ve ridden over the past weeks, that when added together, amounted to what could arguably be considered the mother load of Arcadia. This Wednesday, we’re going back to mine the forest of all the gold Arcadia has to offer, and ride the very same trails that left us feeling richer for having ridden them.

We'll meet at the Frosty Hollow Pond parking area (a 3/4 mile drive up the dirt road from the intersection of Rt 165 & Frosty Hollow Rd), assemble our rides, and then head out. The plan is to ride long enough to keep us out in the woods for up to two hours (single track is our goal, but fire roads will be graciously accepted).

On trail you can expect to experience a combination of fire roads and single-track, passing through forests and fields, over varied terrain, from smooth to rough, over rocks and roots, gravel and dirt which will require a bit of technical skill. But no worries, because we will be following The Unwritten Primary Rules of Mountain Biking: 1. We ride as a group; 2. We hike what we cannot ride; and 3. We wait at all major trailheads. Our pace will be moderate and accommodating (no speedsters here), but you should know that the ride is filled with a number of short steep up and downs, and I ask that you believe yourself to be an intermediately skilled rider, or a fit beginner/intermediate rider willing to be challenged by the terrain. I will be riding a rigid single-speed (no shocks) w/ flat pedals, so my pace will not be blazing (thou my skills are pretty hot), nor will I be riding up every climb (I blame the single-speed); that my friends is for another time.

 

Directions:
From the intersection of Rt 3 and Rt 165, follow Rt 165 east for approximately 2.75 miles. Turn right into Frosty Hollow Rd (dirt road @ the white church) and continue for .75 miles, turning right into a small parking area just after the small fishing pond.

Google Maps: http://maps.google.com/maps?

Coordinates: 41.587755, -71.709374


Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Frosty Hollow Pond parking area (3/4 of a mile North of Rt 165 & the white church); call if you can't find us. Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Bike Arcadia: La Veta Madre
